- The concept of spondyloarthritis groups together chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background:

- Ankylosing spondylitis,

- psoriatic arthritis,

- reactive arthritis,

- arthritis associated with inflammatory enterocolopathies,

- juvenile forms,

- undifferentiated spondyloarthritis,

- and SAPHO syndrome.

- Terminology taken from the ASAS 2009 classification criteria

- Axial spondyloarthritis

- Radiographic = with radiographic sacroiliitis = ankylosing spondylitis.

- Non-radiographic = without radiographic sacroiliitis.

- '''Peripheral articular spondyloarthritis'''

- Erosive.

- Non-erosive.

- Enthesitic peripheral spondyloarthritis

question.title: What is the term used to describe the group of chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background?
question.description: The concept of spondyloarthritis groups together chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background

option_a.title: Spondyloarthropathy
option_a.description: A term that encompasses a range of inflammatory rheumatic diseases, including ankylosing spondylitis and psoriatic arthritis

option_b.title: Rheumatoid arthritis
option_b.description: A chronic inflammatory disease that primarily affects joints, but can also affect other tissues and organs

option_c.title: Spondyloarthritis
option_c.description: The specific term used to describe the group of chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background

option_d.title: Osteoarthritis
option_d.description: A degenerative joint disease that is characterized by wear and tear on joint cartilage

correct_option.title: Spondyloarthritis
correct_option.description: The specific term used to describe the group of chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background
